articles.title: CBI Chargesheet in Transnational Cyber Fraud Case
articles.summary: The CBI filed a chargesheet overnight against 17 accused in a transnational cyber fraud network dismantled after multi‑agency investigations, alleging large‑scale online banking and UPI scams affecting victims across India and abroad; the agency said evidence links organizers to overseas operators and seized digital assets during late‑night raids in multiple states, Dec 14–15 morning reports from national outlets said.

articles.title: Delhi Records Severe Air Pollution Spike Overnight
articles.summary: Delhi's Air Quality Index surged into the 'severe' category overnight, reaching readings above 450 in several monitoring stations, prompting school hybrid‑mode advisories and health warnings from local authorities as cold, calm winds trapped pollutants across the capital region during the early hours.

articles.title: Punjab Rural Polls End with Low Turnout, Opposition Alleges Violence
articles.summary: Zila parishad and block samiti polling in Punjab concluded with an overall turnout of about 48% and opposition parties alleging booth‑level violence and irregularities; the state election authorities said counting arrangements will follow while parties demanded investigations into reported incidents from yesterday evening.

articles.title: NIA Court Issues Public Notice in Delhi Blast Case
articles.summary: An NIA court declared accused Muzaffar Rather a proclaimed offender in an ongoing Delhi blast investigation and ordered public notices and house postings as part of proceedings after the court recorded failure to locate the suspect following searches conducted into the matter overnight.

articles.title: Haryana Removes Shatrujeet Kapur from DGP Charge
articles.summary: The Haryana government divested IPS officer Shatrujeet Kapur of the Director General of Police charge late last night, citing administrative reasons and forwarding records of five officers to the UPSC for empanelment decisions to fill the position, officials told state media.

articles.title: Woman Killed Inside Delhi Temple; One Arrested
articles.summary: Delhi police arrested a suspect after a 48‑year‑old woman was stabbed to death inside a temple late on Sunday; investigators said the arrest occurred overnight and further forensic and CCTV probes are under way to establish motive and identify any accomplices.

articles.title: Karnataka Prisons Chief Launches Phone, Contraband Crackdown
articles.summary: Karnataka's new prisons chief ordered a statewide crackdown within 72 hours of taking charge, leading to seizures of 13 mobile phones and narcotics in multiple jails during late‑night searches as authorities tightened controls on inmate contraband and campaigned for prison reforms.

articles.title: Mumbai‑Hyderabad Expressway, Metro Expansion Announced
articles.summary: Maharashtra Deputy CM announced plans overnight for a Mumbai–Hyderabad expressway, metro expansion and power tariff cuts during the winter session's concluding debate, saying the measures aim to accelerate connectivity and urban infrastructure development across the region.

articles.title: Blast at Jalandhar Scrap Shop Kills One, Injures Two
articles.summary: A blast at a scrap shop in Jalandhar late on Sunday killed one person and injured two others; police identified the deceased and began a probe into the cause of the explosion with preliminary overnight teams inspecting the site for evidence.

articles.title: Indian‑American Leader Urges US Tariff Reversal on Bilateral Trade
articles.summary: An Indian‑American community leader called overnight for the reversal of recent US tariffs to prevent strain in India–US relations and urged policymakers in both countries to seek immediate dialogue to stabilise trade ties, commenting in a press release and interviews circulated to media this morning.
